intro: Astragalus banzragczii, commonly known as Banzragcii milkvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia, particularly Mongolia and adjacent areas. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pea-like flowers that typically range in color from white to pale yellow. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several pairs of small, oval-shaped leaflets. Astragalus banzragczii is adapted to harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
